review: Soyjaks raging over a game while sigmas casually enjoying the shit.

The game doesnt even run on steam deck, crashed twice upon entering a match. Alos there have been reports of people buying the DLC packs for the OW1 hero collections (both versions) and they're both complete wastes of money because they just DON'T WORK? And Blizzard doesn't even want to issue refunds? Very on brand for modern Blizzard (derogatory).

I have never touched the first game, but with 35 total hours on the console version, I can confirm everything Overwatch 2 does can be found in other live service games (here on Steam, mind you!) done better. Lets go over each of OW2's steam banner's selling points and I'll show you what I'm talking about.

"30+ heroes"
- No lie, with the addition of that new sun woman, there are 38 heroes playable (except all of them are either war criminals, wanted fugitives, or rouge "good guys" enacting justice outside of all the countries' legal systems...man this story could've been amazing). 
The characters all have nice designs (except the defaults for Winston, Reinhardt and Sigma) and the art team deserves praise for their work on the game. However every character is so different in-game that keeping track of every characters abilities feels like homework instead of curious in-game observations. In comparison, the fighters in Ubisoft's "For Honor" have enough variations in their playstyle to keep them different, but all of them are generally tied to the same gameplay loop of "fight, support the team, survive", just with different perks, appearances and frame-data.

"5v5 action"
- The movement in Overwatch 2 is very clunky. Mercy, Wrecking Ball, Junkrat and Genji have abilities that negate this, but everyone else moves as slow as molasses. There isn't a feeling of acceleration or speed or freedom of movement or anything, you feel as if you were controlling floating boxes in an unreal engine first draft of a game. 
I'm not saying every character needs to get trapped in canned animations after bumping into anything like that godawful Madden series, but you'd expect at least MOST of these heroes agile enough to 'save the day' to be able to
 wall bounce, double jump, grapple, slide, mount ledges, do flips, wall run, dodge roll, 
or hell, RUN instead of lightly galloping everywhere.

"(Free to Play) Live Service"
- Hilarious choice of words here. It is technically free to start playing, however it is not completely free to play, because heroes (the main selling point of the game) are starting to be locked in the premium battle pass, AKA progression that is not "free"
And even IF you wanted to enjoy yourself without buying the battle pass, you'll quickly notice that you gain almost nothing after each match. Aside from the K/D/A tracker and your stats rolling up, it's as if the match just never happened at all!
In comparison to Deep Rock Galactic, the Payday games and Destiny 2, where every successful outing/heist/mission gets you something tangible, or otherwise shows you that you ARE making progress in this game you like playing by showing you that you are getting closer to being that character build that you want to be.

"Captivating universe"
- this is THE bare minimum you could accomplish when making your game's world. Ideas. However, you can't credit a game's story based on what it could have been (thats what fanfiction is for!) Apparently according to my OW1 veteran friends, the lore was actually quite deep, but since none of those archived missions or cutscenes are available for me to play, and nothing like Destiny 2's "Grimoire card" system exists for me to follow a structured timeline outside of wikipedia, I will simply have to take their word for it. This is what writers should AVOID: telling me that Genji and Hanzo have a complicated relationship through voice lines instead of giving the players a playable level showing us this information.

"Choose your role"
- There are 3 classes of character to choose in this game. However, instead of being a supplement that HELPS with your character and your playstyle like in Apex Legends, the roles actually HARMS your character in overwatch. In Apex, your roles are just suggestions to guide you into helping your team your way; Controls can scan for the next ring and fortify buildings, Supports can provide their teammates with bonus items and specialize in coming to their teammates rescue midfight, and Recons do...recon stuff, ect.
 But in Overwatch? When you choose to be DPS, you are expected to attack relentlessly and score at least 8 kills, as a support, you must be healing your teammates even when it would make more sense to fall back and reposition, and god forbid if you get tank, the isolated SOLO role, and you play anywhere less than frame-perfect, or fail to counterpick at the same tempo as your opposition, you would be "throwing the game"

"Ultimate abilities"
- I LOVE ultimate abilities in others game. 
OTHER games. 
A good game with these needs to have those ultimates feel empowering to the user, but also needs to provide counterplay against them so that the game is still skill first and foremost.
Why even worry about my teammates, when I can hit 5 buttons as dps and rack up 3 free kills? 
or hit 2 buttons as a tank and scare the entire enemy team back to spawn? 
Or hit ONE button as a support and give my team a billion health points for 10 seconds? 
Normally there is counterplay to ultimate attacks or combos or team synergies. And these are more than just- 
"don't get hit by this." "kill this character before they do that"
In comparison to Valorant, all of those ultimate abilities require the user to have the basic game-sense learned, in addition to their instinct and planning/coordinating skills. Those could also be countered by really prepared players and the enemies could then retaliate by switching up their gameplan a bit, not slowing the game down at all.

"Story missions"
- These are not free for anyone. In the fine print it says that, but still. Everyone that bought Overwatch 1 for 60$ in year 1? Won't be guaranteed the story missions.
Everyone who bought the watchpoint pack of overwatch for 40$ 2 years ago, promising them that those versions of the game would have story missions when 1 turned into 2? Won't be guaranteed those story missions.
Nope this is a separate fee you have to pay in order to play the story mode. Destiny 2 does something similar with their expansion content, except with that, you're guaranteed the story, the missions, the gear, the strike challenges, and the open world. Overwatch 2 can barely manage to have a single sufficient set of story missions. So far we don't know if these will have timed access or if they would become yours to keep.

"Cross play and progression"
+ I have got to be honest with you, aside from the sound design and voice acting, this is the only thing this game has over the other live services. It's still not as simple as Fortnite's cross progression and machine-hopping, but I have seen no issues.
Of course this doesn't count as gameplay.

PvE Alternatives!

+ If you enjoy the prospect of grabbing 1-3 friends and setting off into a set piece level to be a bunch of badasses together, I would suggest,,,,,

*Starbreeze Studios 's "Payday 2", 
if you crave a challenge or want to try your odds at speedrunning robberies (10$, 2$ on sale)
* Ghost Ship Games' "DeepRock Galactic", 
if you were more interested in Overwatch PvE's character diversity and role specialty. (30$, 10$ on sale)
* Valve's "Left 4 Dead 2", 
if you were legitimately interested in a multiplayer campaign you can play with friends from start to finish. (10$, 1$ on sale)
* Evil Mojo Games' "Paladins"
if you can sacrifice the Overwatch nostalgia for overall better gameplay (Free, 30+GB) 

Summary
- This is by far the most irresponsible game development I've ever seen. Between this and Diablo 4 also being a huge money sink, Bobby Kotick needs to be held accountable.

It's incredible how Blizzard has lied again and again about their plans and goals with OW2. Their true goal is to pump as much money from you as possible before they abandon the game in a year. Don't believe their bs.

This game made me realize I'm a masochist. Playing this game every day I've realized I must like the feeling of never ending torture. Playing overwatch is like getting kicked in your balls repeatedly without any breaks then getting that big fat lose text over your screen as you beg for more when you que up once more. I've come to realize that I like getting repeatedly kicked in my balls since I can't stop playing this game. Every time I open the game I can feel my life shorten as my brain tries to mentally prepare for the hours of mental torture it's about to recieve. 10/10 would recommend for my fellow masochist.

I have been playing for a long time and I really like this game. I see a lot of idiots on Steam who complain about everything. They teach you a cool job. Just delete it and play another game if you don't like it!!!

cat

Once upon a time, I had a cat, I had ten dollars, I would buy it food for eight dollars, bathe it often, and it was very sticky to me.

Later, I took it out to play, passers-by thought it was cute, they fed it cat food, ham sausage, I was very unhappy because it was mine. I wanted to carry it home, but he broke away from me and meowed at the person who gave it good food, I hugged him a few times and he didn't go with me, and scratched me, so I turned around and left.....

Later, I came across it by chance on the road, and it was dirty. Passers-by will only give it good food and play with it, but they will not take it home and bathe it. It saw me and followed me home, I shut it out, it meowed outside the door, it was very uncomfortable,
but I wouldn't want it anymore
.

ĞÑ‡ĞµĞ½ÑŒ ĞºĞ°Ñ‡ĞµÑÑ‚Ğ²ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ğ¾ ÑÑ‚Ğ²ĞµĞ½Ğ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ¿Ğ¾Ğ´Ğ±Ğ¾Ñ€ Ğ¸Ğ³Ñ€Ğ¾ĞºĞ¾Ğ² Ğ¸ Ğ¸Ğ´Ğ¸Ğ¾Ñ‚Ğ¾Ğ² Ğ±Ğ°Ğ»ÑŒĞ½Ñ‹Ğ¹ Ğ±Ğ°Ğ»Ğ°Ğ½Ñ Ğ³ĞµÑ€Ğ¾ĞµĞ²
